title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
text: Matrix Analysis Metadata Standards (MAMS) can used capture relevant information data matrices annotations produced common complex analysis workflows single-cell data. use case demonstrates MAMS can used annotate matrices annotations produced analysis multi-modal single-cell data containing RNA Antibody Derived Tags (ADTs). analyze PBMC 1K dataset Seurat package according Multi-modal Weighted Nearst Neighbor vignettes. analytical steps include: Importing raw/droplet filtered/cell matrices Performing quality control subsetting filtered matrix include high-quality cells Clustering cells RNA Clustering cells ADTs Clustering cells RNA ADT Clustering T-cells RNA Clustering T-cells ADT Clustering T-cells RNA ADT workflow demonstrates different subsets cells/observations produced due QC/filtering can made based different biological subsets. also produces several matrices annotations different modalities. Note goal workflow less producing best clustering results cell type characterization. Rather focused producing data/results commonly generated real-world analyses can annotated MAMS. information MAMS, see GitHub repository

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: library(dplyr) library(Seurat) library(patchwork) raw.matrices <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/raw_feature_bc_matrix/") #> 10X data contains more than one type and is being returned as a list containing matrices of each type. data.raw <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = raw.matrices[[1]], assay = "RNA", project = "pbmc1k") adt <- CreateAssayObject(counts = raw.matrices[[2]]) data.raw[["ADT"]] <- adt  nonempty.matrices <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix") #> 10X data contains more than one type and is being returned as a list containing matrices of each type. data.nonempty <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = nonempty.matrices[[1]], assay = "RNA", project = "pbmc1k") adt <- CreateAssayObject(counts = nonempty.matrices[[2]]) data.nonempty[["ADT"]] <- adt

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analyzing all cells
what: RNA only clustering of all cells
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: DefaultAssay(data) <- 'RNA' data <- NormalizeData(data) %>% FindVariableFeatures() %>% ScaleData() %>% RunPCA() data <- FindNeighbors(data, dims = 1:10) data <- FindClusters(data, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data <- RunUMAP(data, reduction = 'pca', dims = 1:10, assay = 'RNA',                reduction.name = 'rna.umap', reduction.key = 'rnaUMAP_') DimPlot(data, reduction = 'rna.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analyzing all cells
what: ADT only clustering of all cells
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: DefaultAssay(data) <- 'ADT' VariableFeatures(data) <- rownames(data[["ADT"]]) data <- NormalizeData(data, normalization.method = 'CLR', margin = 2) %>%    ScaleData() %>% RunPCA(reduction.name = 'apca', dims = 1:10) data <- FindNeighbors(data, reduction = "apca", dims = 1:10) data <- FindClusters(data, graph.name = "ADT_snn", resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data <- RunUMAP(data, reduction = 'apca', dims = 1:10,                reduction.name = 'adt.umap', reduction.key = 'adtUMAP_') DimPlot(data, reduction = 'adt.umap')

title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: data <- FindMultiModalNeighbors(   data, reduction.list = list("pca", "apca"),    dims.list = list(1:20, 1:10), modality.weight.name = "RNA.weight" ) data <- RunUMAP(data, nn.name = "weighted.nn", reduction.name = "wnn.umap", reduction.key = "wnnUMAP_") data <- FindClusters(data, graph.name = "wsnn", algorithm = 3, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) DimPlot(data, reduction = 'wnn.umap', label = TRUE, repel = TRUE) FeaturePlot(data, features = c("adt_CD3","rna_CD3E"), reduction = 'wnn.umap')

text: data matrices stored within Seurat object saved “rds” file. Note extract save matrix basic txt mtx file well.
code: data.tcell <- FindMultiModalNeighbors(   data.tcell, reduction.list = list("pca.tcell", "apca.tcell"),   dims.list = list(1:10, 1:10), modality.weight.name = "RNA.weight" ) data.tcell <- RunUMAP(data.tcell, nn.name = "weighted.nn", reduction.name = "wnn.tcell.umap", reduction.key = "wnnTcellUMAP_") data.tcell <- FindClusters(data.tcell, graph.name = "wsnn", algorithm = 3, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) DimPlot(data.tcell, reduction = 'wnn.tcell.umap', label = TRUE, repel = TRUE) saveRDS(data.raw, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_raw.rds") saveRDS(data.nonempty, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_nonempty.rds") saveRDS(data, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_filtered.rds") saveRDS(data.tcell, "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_tcell.rds")

previous_headings: Introduction > Step 2: Creating the MAMS object from seurat object
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: library(rmams)  # get the file paths of seurat objects  file_paths <- c("../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_filtered.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_nonempty.rds", "../inst/extdata/pbmc1k_seurat_tcell.rds")  # get the names of these objects  file_names <-  gsub(pattern = "\\.rds$", replacement = "", x = basename(file_paths))  # save the seurat objects onto the object_list by reading the object from file path. object_list <- lapply(file_paths, readRDS)  # name the list objects using previously generated file_names. names(object_list) <- file_names  # define the type of each subset observational_subsets<-c("filtered","nonempty","subset") datasetid = "PBMC1K"

previous_headings: Introduction > Support for Seurat V5 objects
what: In this example we show how we can extract counts from Seurat V5 object and make a V3 object that can be used with rmams pacakge
title: Creating MAMS from Seurat
code: options(Seurat.object.assay.version = "v5")   pbmc.counts <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix/") pbmc <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = pbmc.counts) class(pbmc[["RNA"]]) #> [1] "Assay5" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "SeuratObject"  # Extract counts from v5 v3_counts = LayerData(pbmc, assay="RNA", layer='counts')  # make v3 object   options(Seurat.object.assay.version = "v3") pbmc_v3 <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = v3_counts) class(pbmc_v3[["RNA"]]) #> [1] "Assay" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "SeuratObject"  # This pbmc_v3 can now be used with rmams pacakge

what: R package for Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
text: Many molecular datasets generated across cancer types contain multi-modal data collected longitudinally- spatially-related biological specimens. major roadblock goal data stored wide variety file formats programming language-specific libraries, classes, data structures. Although wide range experimental protocols platforms available, important commonality across technologies often produce matrix features measured set observations. order facilitate data sharing across groups technologies, assays, promote interoperability -stream analysis tools, detailed data schema describing characteristics FOMs developed serve standard useful community.

title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
text: rmams package can installed remotes package using following command:
code: devtools::install_github("single-cell-mams/rmams")

title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
text: can access detailed tutorial use rmams package .
code: library(Seurat) options(Seurat.object.assay.version = "v3") counts <- matrix(rpois((500*200), 1), nrow = 500, ncol = 200, dimnames = list(paste0("Row", 1:500), paste0("Col", 1:200))) srt <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = counts) srt <- NormalizeData(srt) subset_srt <- srt[, 1:100] mams <- convert_seurat_to_MAMS(object_list = list(srt = srt, subset_srt = subset_srt),   observation_subsets = c("full", "subset"), dataset_id = "dataset1") print(mams)

Matrix analysis metadata standards (MAMS) facilitate harmonization reproducibility single cell data. bioRxiv [Preprint]. 2023 Mar 7:2023.03.06.531314. doi: 10.1101/2023.03.06.531314. PMID: 36945543; PMCID: PMC10028847.
